additionalTextInformation.text:
A similar composition, though with alterations to the position of the arms and background, is in the Hermitage (inv. 8504). That painting is listed as from the workshop of Lucas Cranach the Elder, and is paired with a 'Dying Cleopatra' which features a near identical pose and interior design, albeit in the reverse orientation to both the Hermitage picture and the present version.

[Sotheby's online database: http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-paintings-n08952/lot.223.html?locale=en]; accessed 13.08.2019]


In the digital collection of the Hermitage, the panel of Cleopatra is listed as 'Lucas Cranach II. (?)'

[Hermitage online database:https://www.hermitagemuseum.org/wps/portal/hermitage/digital-collection//01.%20paintings/38453/; accessed 14.10.2019]

pageContext.description: The painting is in landscape format and shows Marc Anthony, reclining naked on a bed in front of a window, that reveals an expansive landscape with water. His sword is positioned beside him on the bedside table.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 38.7 x 50.3 cm; 15 1/8 x 19 3/4 in.
[Sotheby's online database: http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-paintings-n08952/lot.223.html?locale=en] (accessed 13.08.2019)

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
The following condition report has been provided by Simon Parkes of Simon Parkes Art Conservation, Inc. 502 East 74th St. New York, NY 212-734-3920, simonparkes@msn.com, an independent restorer who is not an employee of Sotheby's. "This panel is flat and has never been reinforced. The paint layer is stable. In the lower left, some wood worm has made the panel soft. There are some cracks and losses here as well as in the lower right. The remainder of the painting is recently cleaned and freshly varnished. There are small spots of retouching here and there, but none of them are focused on any particular area. Considering the period, the condition is very presentable. The panel does need consolidation across the bottom edge."
[Sotheby's online database: http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/old-master-paintings-n08952/lot.223.html?locale=en] (accessed 13.08.2019)
